alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 1:32PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Box Butte and eastern Sioux Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1232 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Kilpatrick Lake, or 26 miles west of Alliance, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Box Butte and eastern Sioux Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
